content: in a legal case that lasted for over 3 years the viru county court made a final decision the details of the case are not mentioned but one party is responsible for covering the procedural costs a compromise agreement was reached between three parties j l and j which terminates a joint estate and divides the deceased persons share j and l have agreed to jointly and severally pay j compensation for a property loss the payment will be made in monthly installments over 6 months the compromise agreement resolves all disputes between the parties the court has refused to consider a counterclaim by j and l the civil case is terminated and the costs of the proceedings will be borne by the parties the court order has been sent to the parties and there is a possibility to appeal the court order the court clarifies the process of requesting procedural aid and the division of the estate the claimant is seeking ownership of a portion of the property and monetary compensation the defendants contest the claim and propose a compromise the court sets deadlines for the parties to submit their positions and observations the parties reach an agreement in principle and submit a compromise agreement the court suggests changes to the agreement and receives the revised version the compromise will come into effect once signed by the parties and confirmed by the court the court examines the compromise and approves it the counterclaim is refused and the parties agree to bear the costs the court exempts the claimant from paying certain fees the claimant is ordered to pay the state costs of the proceedings the court allows for payment in installments and exempts the claimant from reimbursing the state the claimant is released from the obligation to reimburse the state
